intro: Scabiosa columbaria subsp. vogesiaca, commonly known as the Voges scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe, particularly found in grasslands and open woodlands. It produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, angular stems and lance-shaped leaves with toothed edges. It is part of the Caprifoliaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different flower structure and geographic distribution compared to the main species.
